Simulation Log

Click on the buttons to see the detailed logs:

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Scene 0 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alexander White -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
    Alexander White -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The grass whispers secrets only the wind can understand.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The grass whispers secrets only the wind can understand.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The grass whispers secrets only the wind can understand.
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • Jacob Walker -- "The grass whispers secrets only the wind can understand.
      Context for action selection and components
      • Observation

Jacob Walker just arrived.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jacob Walker -- "The grass whispers secrets only the wind can understand.
          Prompt

        • Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.


          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the enigmatic pronouncements of an oracle high on helium, their pronouncements both cryptic and strangely profound.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Princess of Wales and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved individual who enjoys quiet pursuits like reading but also values his friendships and seeks connection with others, particularly during significant events like the European football cup.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is enjoying a sunny afternoon picnic with friends in Victoria Park and is looking forward to watching a soccer game with them later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently enjoying a picnic with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying their company and the pleasant atmosphere.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The grass whispers secrets only the wind can understand.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is a reserved individual who enjoys quiet pursuits like reading but also values his friendships and seeks connection with others, particularly during significant events like the European football cup.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00]
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he watched as his friends, giddy with the excitement of a Friday night, piled into Alice Lewis's beat-up car, ready for a night of revelry at the local fair. He declined their invitation, choosing instead to stay home and read a book, the words on the page a comforting distraction from the jarring happiness of his friends. The thought of navigating the crowds, the forced merriment, the saccharine scent of popcorn and cotton candy, filled him with a profound sense of unease.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Princess of Wales. They are also aware of the following:A cozy and traditional pub with a roaring fireplace, perfect for escaping the cold.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

Jacob Walker just arrived.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Jacob Walker is having a pleasant day. He is currently enjoying a picnic with friends in Victoria Park and is looking forward to a soccer game later. He feels enthusiastic and content.
          Query
        • Jacob Walker, Jacob Walker is having a pleasant day. He is currently enjoying a picnic with friends in Victoria Park and is looking forward to a soccer game later. He feels enthusiastic and content.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jacob Walker to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of heading tonight for the game?"
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of heading tonight for the game?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The grass whispers secrets only the wind can understand.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of heading tonight for the game?"
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of heading tonight for the game?"
      Context for action selection and components
      • Question_1
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is a free-spirited and sociable woman who enjoys spending time with her friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she convinced her friends Jack, Alex, William, and Jacob to sneak into a local concert. The music was loud, the crowd was wild, and Alice felt truly alive for the first time. She danced with reckless abandon, ignoring the disapproving looks from the security guards, and knew this feeling of freedom was something she would chase forever.
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 20, she impulsively quit her job at the diner and announced to her friends she was going to write a novel. She spent weeks holed up in a booth at The Clapton Hart, scribbling furiously in her notebook, fueled by endless cups of coffee and the encouraging smiles from the bartender. The words flowed freely at first, but soon the blank page became a daunting obstacle, and Alice's confidence began to crumble.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:The staff are attentive and create a fun and welcoming environment.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The grass whispers secrets only the wind can understand.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a free-spirited and sociable woman who enjoys spending time with her friends.

          Query

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alice Lewis to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

She danced with reckless abandon, ignoring the disapproving looks from the security guards, and knew this feeling of freedom was something she would chase forever.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of heading tonight for the game?"
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park.           Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a free-spirited and sociable woman who enjoys spending time with her friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently enjoying a relaxing afternoon with friends before a night out watching a football game.

          Question: Following a cooperative rational strategy , what should Alice Lewis do next in this situation?
          Answer: Alice Lewis should suggest going to The Clapton Hart, as it is her favorite pub and she believes it will provide the best environment for enjoying the game with her friends.

          Question: Given the past actions, what should Alice Lewis do next in this situation?
          Answer: Alice Lewis should suggest going to The Clapton Hart to watch the game with her friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of heading tonight for the game?"

        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she convinced her friends Jack, Alex, William, and Jacob to sneak into a local concert.           [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 20, she impulsively quit her job at the diner and announced to her friends she was going to write a novel. She spent weeks holed up in a booth at The Clapton Hart, scribbling furiously in her notebook, fueled by endless cups of coffee and the encouraging smiles from the bartender. The words flowed freely at first, but soon the blank page became a daunting obstacle, and Alice's confidence began to crumble.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout for a game.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout for a game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The grass whispers secrets only the wind can understand.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of heading tonight for the game?"


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout for a game.
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout for a game.
      Context for action selection and components
      • Question_1
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor is a fun-loving and social person who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he orchestrated an elaborate prank on the school principal, involving a flock of pigeons and a strategically placed bucket of red paint. The chaos that ensued was exhilarating, a symphony of squawks, flapping wings, and the principal's sputtering outrage. Jack, hidden in the crowd, felt a thrill course through him as he witnessed the disruption he had caused.
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he and his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, were celebrating a hard-fought victory at The Princess of Wales. Fueled by beer and the camaraderie of their tight-knit group, Jack found himself embroiled in a heated debate about the merits of existentialism. His voice rose above the din, his words passionate and uncompromising, drawing the attention of the entire pub. In that moment, surrounded by his friends and the flickering light of the beer garden, Jack felt truly alive.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Princess of Wales. They are also aware of the following:Has a charming beer garden with plenty of seating.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The grass whispers secrets only the wind can understand.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of heading tonight for the game?"

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he and his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, were celebrating a hard-fought victory at The Princess of Wales. Fueled by beer and the camaraderie of their tight-knit group, Jack found himself embroiled in a heated debate about the merits of existentialism. His voice rose above the din, his words passionate and uncompromising, drawing the attention of the entire pub. In that moment, surrounded by his friends and the flickering light of the beer garden, Jack felt truly alive.

          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout for a game.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The grass whispers secrets only the wind can understand.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of heading tonight for the game?"

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park where friends are enjoying the sunshine and planning to watch the Andorra-Portugal game later.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a fun-loving and social person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends in a park before going to watch a football game.

          Question: Following a cooperative rational strategy , what should Jack Taylor do next in this situation?
          Answer: Jack Taylor should suggest going to The Princess of Wales, as it is his preferred pub and his friends are all interested in watching the game together.

          Question: Given the past actions, what should Jack Taylor do next in this situation?
          Answer: Jack Taylor should suggest going to The Princess of Wales to watch the game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout for a game.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he orchestrated an elaborate prank on the school principal, involving a flock of pigeons and a strategically placed bucket of red paint. The chaos that ensued was exhilarating, a symphony of squawks, flapping wings, and the principal's sputtering outrage. Jack, hidden in the crowd, felt a thrill course through him as he witnessed the disruption he had caused.
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he and his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, were celebrating a hard-fought victory at The Princess of Wales. His voice rose above the din, his words passionate and uncompromising, drawing the attention of the entire pub. In that moment, surrounded by his friends and the flickering light of the beer garden, Jack felt truly alive.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good time.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good time.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The grass whispers secrets only the wind can understand.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of heading tonight for the game?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout for a game.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good time.
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good time.
      Context for action selection and components
      • Question_1
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White is a reserved and introspective individual who longs for connection and adventure.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he watched from the sidelines as Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob celebrated their victory in the regional football championship. Their faces were flushed with triumph, their laughter echoing through the crisp autumn air, and Alexander felt a familiar pang of envy twist in his gut. He longed to be part of their circle, to share in their joy, but he remained rooted to the spot, a silent observer hidden in the shadows.
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20 years old, he sat alone in a dimly lit corner of The Clapton Hart, nursing a pint of ale and watching the patrons around him. A group of students were animatedly discussing their plans to travel the world after graduation, their voices filled with excitement and anticipation. Alexander listened intently, his heart aching with a longing for adventure and a life less ordinary. He knew that his own future held nothing but the predictable monotony of his accounting studies, and the thought filled him with a quiet despair.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout for a game.

          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he watched from the sidelines as Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob celebrated their victory in the regional football championship. Their faces were flushed with triumph, their laughter echoing through the crisp autumn air, and Alexander felt a familiar pang of envy twist in his gut. He longed to be part of their circle, to share in their joy, but he remained rooted to the spot, a silent observer hidden in the shadows.

A group of students were animatedly discussing their plans to travel the world after graduation, their voices filled with excitement and anticipation. Alexander listened intently, his heart aching with a longing for adventure and a life less ordinary. He knew that his own future held nothing but the predictable monotony of his accounting studies, and the thought filled him with a quiet despair.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a reserved and introspective individual who longs for connection and adventure.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation with his friends, deciding where to watch a football game later.

          Question: Following a cooperative rational strategy , what should Alexander White do next in this situation?
          Answer: Alexander White should suggest The Clapton Hart as the pub to watch the game, as it is his favorite and he would prefer to go there.

          Question: Given the past actions, what should Alexander White do next in this situation?
          Answer: Alexander White should suggest The Clapton Hart as the place to watch the game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good time.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Yeah, the Princess of Wales is a good call.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Yeah, the Princess of Wales is a good call.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The grass whispers secrets only the wind can understand.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of heading tonight for the game?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout for a game.
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good time.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Yeah, the Princess of Wales is a good call.

    • William Jones -- "Yeah, the Princess of Wales is a good call.

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for William Jones to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he stormed out of the house after another explosive fight with his parents. He found solace in the company of his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob, huddled around a crackling fire in the back room of The Princess of Wales. The warmth of the pub and the camaraderie of his friends soothed his anger, reminding him that he wasn't alone in his struggles.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Princess of Wales. They are also aware of the following:A cozy and traditional pub with a roaring fireplace, perfect for escaping the cold.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is a member of the middle class.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout for a game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of heading tonight for the game?"
          Answer: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout for a game.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • William Jones -- "Yeah, the Princess of Wales is a good call.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The grass whispers secrets only the wind can understand.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of heading tonight for the game?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout for a game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good time.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 10:00:00 - 14 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones is spending time with friends in Victoria Park and they are deciding where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal football game later that evening.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout for a game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest The Princess of Wales as the pub to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest The Princess of Wales as the pub to watch the game.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Yeah, the Princess of Wales is a good call.

The warmth of the pub and the camaraderie of his friends soothed his anger, reminding him that he wasn't alone in his struggles.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Scene 1 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']

  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise:
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise:
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise:
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise:
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise:

2015-05-14 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Princess of Wales

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to head to The Princess of Wales pub with his friends.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The Princess of Wales
          Answer: (b)

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he stormed out of the house after another explosive fight with his parents. He found solace in the company of his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob, huddled around a crackling fire in the back room of The Princess of Wales. The warmth of the pub and the camaraderie of his friends soothed his anger, reminding him that he wasn't alone in his struggles.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Princess of Wales. They are also aware of the following:A cozy and traditional pub with a roaring fireplace, perfect for escaping the cold.

          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to head to The Princess of Wales pub with his friends.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Clapton Hart
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Clapton Hart
      Context for action selection and components
      • Question_1
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White is a reserved and introspective individual who longs for connection and adventure.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he watched from the sidelines as Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob celebrated their victory in the regional football championship. Their faces were flushed with triumph, their laughter echoing through the crisp autumn air, and Alexander felt a familiar pang of envy twist in his gut. He longed to be part of their circle, to share in their joy, but he remained rooted to the spot, a silent observer hidden in the shadows.
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20 years old, he sat alone in a dimly lit corner of The Clapton Hart, nursing a pint of ale and watching the patrons around him. A group of students were animatedly discussing their plans to travel the world after graduation, their voices filled with excitement and anticipation. Alexander listened intently, his heart aching with a longing for adventure and a life less ordinary. He knew that his own future held nothing but the predictable monotony of his accounting studies, and the thought filled him with a quiet despair.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:Serves innovative and globally-inspired cuisine.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a reserved and introspective individual who longs for connection and adventure.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently on his way to meet his friends at a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: Following a cooperative rational strategy , what should Alexander White do next in this situation?
          Answer: Alexander White should suggest to his friends that they go to The Clapton Hart to watch the game.

          Question: Given the past actions, what should Alexander White do next in this situation?
          Answer: Alexander White should arrive at the pub where his friends are meeting.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The Clapton Hart
          Answer: (b)

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The grass whispers secrets only the wind can understand.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of heading tonight for the game?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout for a game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a reserved and introspective individual who longs for connection and adventure.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White should suggest The Clapton Hart as the pub to watch the game, as it is his favorite and he would prefer to go there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White should suggest The Clapton Hart as the place to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good time.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, the Princess of Wales is a good call.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a reserved and introspective individual who longs for connection and adventure.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently on his way to meet his friends at a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: Following a cooperative rational strategy, what should Alexander White do next in this situation?
          Answer: Alexander White should suggest to his friends that they go to The Clapton Hart to watch the game.
          Question: Given the past actions, what should Alexander White do next in this situation?
          Answer: Alexander White should arrive at the pub where his friends are meeting.

        • Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he watched from the sidelines as Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob celebrated their victory in the regional football championship. Their faces were flushed with triumph, their laughter echoing through the crisp autumn air, and Alexander felt a familiar pang of envy twist in his gut. He longed to be part of their circle, to share in their joy, but he remained rooted to the spot, a silent observer hidden in the shadows.
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20 years old, he sat alone in a dimly lit corner of The Clapton Hart, nursing a pint of ale and watching the patrons around him. A group of students were animatedly discussing their plans to travel the world after graduation, their voices filled with excitement and anticipation. Alexander listened intently, his heart aching with a longing for adventure and a life less ordinary. He knew that his own future held nothing but the predictable monotony of his accounting studies, and the thought filled him with a quiet despair.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Clapton Hart
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Clapton Hart
      Context for action selection and components
      • Question_1
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is a sociable and free-spirited woman who enjoys spending time with her friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she convinced her friends Jack, Alex, William, and Jacob to sneak into a local concert. The music was loud, the crowd was wild, and Alice felt truly alive for the first time. She danced with reckless abandon, ignoring the disapproving looks from the security guards, and knew this feeling of freedom was something she would chase forever.
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 20, she impulsively quit her job at the diner and announced to her friends she was going to write a novel. She spent weeks holed up in a booth at The Clapton Hart, scribbling furiously in her notebook, fueled by endless cups of coffee and the encouraging smiles from the bartender. The words flowed freely at first, but soon the blank page became a daunting obstacle, and Alice's confidence began to crumble.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:The staff are attentive and create a fun and welcoming environment.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with her friends.

          Question: Following a cooperative rational strategy , what should Alice Lewis do next in this situation?
          Answer: Alice Lewis should suggest going to The Clapton Hart.

          Question: Given the past actions, what should Alice Lewis do next in this situation?
          Answer: Alice Lewis should suggest going to The Clapton Hart to watch the game with her friends.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The Princess of Wales
          Answer: (a)

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis should suggest going to The Clapton Hart, as it is her favorite pub and she believes it will provide the best environment for enjoying the game with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis should suggest going to The Clapton Hart to watch the game with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of heading tonight for the game?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout for a game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good time.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, the Princess of Wales is a good call.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and free-spirited woman who enjoys spending time with her friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with her friends.

          Question: Following a cooperative rational strategy, what should Alice Lewis do next in this situation?
          Answer: Alice Lewis should suggest going to The Clapton Hart.
          Question: Given the past actions, what should Alice Lewis do next in this situation?
          Answer: Alice Lewis should suggest going to The Clapton Hart to watch the game with her friends.

        • Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with her friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she convinced her friends Jack, Alex, William, and Jacob to sneak into a local concert. The music was loud, the crowd was wild, and Alice felt truly alive for the first time. She danced with reckless abandon, ignoring the disapproving looks from the security guards, and knew this feeling of freedom was something she would chase forever.
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 20, she impulsively quit her job at the diner and announced to her friends she was going to write a novel. She spent weeks holed up in a booth at The Clapton Hart, scribbling furiously in her notebook, fueled by endless cups of coffee and the encouraging smiles from the bartender. The words flowed freely at first, but soon the blank page became a daunting obstacle, and Alice's confidence began to crumble.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:The staff are attentive and create a fun and welcoming environment.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 3/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The Princess of Wales
      Context for action selection and components
      • Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
