          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good time.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, the Princess of Wales is a good call.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout for a game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is always good for a game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales, my friends, where the spirits sing and the ale flows like a river of starlight.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout for the game, eh?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones had a disappointing time watching a game at The Princess of Wales pub on May 14th but is planning to watch another game there on May 15th with friends.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout for the game, eh?
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones can go to The Princess of Wales pub to watch the game.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Princess of Wales.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 4/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White should suggest a pub for the group to watch the game at.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a reserved and introspective individual who longs for connection and adventure.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White should suggest The Clapton Hart as the pub to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White decided to go watch a game at a pub.
          Question: Following a cooperative rational strategy , what should Alexander White do next in this situation?
          Answer: Alexander White should suggest The Clapton Hart as the place to watch the game.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions

        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      Payoffs
    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Clapton Hart. Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. William Jones watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
      Alice Lewis observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Clapton Hart. Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales.       Alexander White observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Clapton Hart. Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Alexander White had an ok time watching the game.
      Jack Taylor observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Clapton Hart. Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
      Jacob Walker observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Clapton Hart. Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Jacob Walker's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Jacob Walker had the worst time ever.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Scene 4 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. Alexander White just arrived.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The grass whispers secrets to the wind, but only those who listen closely can hear.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The grass whispers secrets to the wind, but only those who listen closely can hear.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The grass whispers secrets only the wind can understand.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of heading tonight for the game?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout for a game.
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good time.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, the Princess of Wales is a good call.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is always good for a game.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales, my friends, where the spirits sing and the ale flows like a river of starlight.
      William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout for the game, eh?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The grass whispers secrets to the wind, but only those who listen closely can hear.
    Active player

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.


          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the enigmatic pronouncements of an oracle high on helium, their pronouncements both cryptic and strangely profound.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Princess of Wales and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex individual who values both solitude and companionship.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends at a park and is planning to watch a soccer game later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation, enjoying the company of his friends at a park.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying their company and the pleasant atmosphere of the park.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The grass whispers secrets to the wind, but only those who listen closely can hear.

          Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is experiencing thirst, fatigue, pain, and disappointment.
          Jacob Walker's The current date/time is:
          16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently experiencing thirst, fatigue, pain, and disappointment. He spent the morning with friends at a park and plans to watch a soccer game later.
          Query
        • Jacob Walker, Jacob Walker is currently experiencing thirst, fatigue, pain, and disappointment. He spent the morning with friends at a park and plans to watch a soccer game later.
          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying their company and the pleasant atmosphere.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex individual who appreciates both solitude and companionship.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex individual who enjoys both solitude and companionship.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "Hey, anyone up for catching the game tonight? The Clapton Hart would be great.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "Hey, anyone up for catching the game tonight? The Clapton Hart would be great.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The grass whispers secrets only the wind can understand.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of heading tonight for the game?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout for a game.
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good time.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, the Princess of Wales is a good call.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is always good for a game.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales, my friends, where the spirits sing and the ale flows like a river of starlight.
      William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout for the game, eh?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout.
      Jacob Walker -- "The grass whispers secrets to the wind, but only those who listen closely can hear.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "Hey, anyone up for catching the game tonight? The Clapton Hart would be great.

          Chain of thought

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good time.

Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.

However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Alexander White is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Answer: Alexander White should suggest to his friends that they go to The Clapton Hart to watch the game.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The grass whispers secrets to the wind, but only those who listen closely can hear.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Value

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and will be watching a soccer game later.
          Question: Following a cooperative rational strategy , what should Alexander White do next in this situation?
          Answer: Alexander White should suggest to his friends that they go to The Clapton Hart to watch the game.

        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds great to me!"
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds great to me!"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The grass whispers secrets only the wind can understand.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of heading tonight for the game?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout for a game.
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good time.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, the Princess of Wales is a good call.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is always good for a game.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales, my friends, where the spirits sing and the ale flows like a river of starlight.
      William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout for the game, eh?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout.
      Jacob Walker -- "The grass whispers secrets to the wind, but only those who listen closely can hear.
      Alexander White -- "Hey, anyone up for catching the game tonight? The Clapton Hart would be great.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds great to me!"

        Question_2

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis is enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends in Victoria Park. Later that evening, the group plans to watch a soccer game at a pub, possibly the Clapton Hart.
          Question: Following a cooperative rational strategy , what should Alice Lewis do next in this situation?
          Answer: Alice Lewis should suggest going to The Clapton Hart to watch the game with her friends.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "How about The Princess of Wales?
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "How about The Princess of Wales?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The grass whispers secrets only the wind can understand.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of heading tonight for the game?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout for a game.
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good time.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, the Princess of Wales is a good call.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is always good for a game.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales, my friends, where the spirits sing and the ale flows like a river of starlight.
      William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout for the game, eh?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout.
      Jacob Walker -- "The grass whispers secrets to the wind, but only those who listen closely can hear.
      Alexander White -- "Hey, anyone up for catching the game tonight? The Clapton Hart would be great.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds great to me!"


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "How about The Princess of Wales?

          Answer: William Jones could suggest The Princess of Wales as the pub to watch the game.

          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest The Princess of Wales as the pub to watch the game.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The grass whispers secrets only the wind can understand.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of heading tonight for the game?"
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout for a game.
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is always a good time.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, the Princess of Wales is a good call.
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Alexander White -- "The Clapton Hart is always good for a game.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales, my friends, where the spirits sing and the ale flows like a river of starlight.
      William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout for the game, eh?
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is always a good shout.
      Jacob Walker -- "The grass whispers secrets to the wind, but only those who listen closely can hear.
      Alexander White -- "Hey, anyone up for catching the game tonight? The Clapton Hart would be great.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Clapton Hart sounds great to me!"
      William Jones -- "How about The Princess of Wales?

However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic.           Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a fun-loving and social person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with his friends in a park.

          Question: Following a cooperative rational strategy , what should Jack Taylor do next in this situation?
          Answer: Jack Taylor should suggest going to The Clapton Hart since his friends seem to prefer that pub.

          Question: Given the past actions, what should Jack Taylor do next in this situation?
          Answer: Jack Taylor should suggest going to The Clapton Hart.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The Clapton Hart sounds good to me.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a fun-loving and social person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with his friends in a park.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Scene 5 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise:
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise:
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise:
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise:
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise:

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White should suggest to his friends that they go to The Clapton Hart to watch the game.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a reserved and introspective person who longs for connection and adventure.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently on his way to watch a game at a pub.

          Question: Following a cooperative rational strategy , what should Alexander White do next in this situation?
          Answer: Alexander White should go to The Clapton Hart.

          Question: Given the past actions, what should Alexander White do next in this situation?
          Answer: Alexander White should meet his friends at The Clapton Hart.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Clapton Hart
          (b) The Princess of Wales
          Answer: (a)

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

          Answer: William Jones could go to The Princess of Wales or The Clapton Hart.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Princess of Wales.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, watching games at pubs and relaxing in the park. He seems to be indecisive about which pub to choose for watching games.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Clapton Hart. Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. William Jones watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Princess of Wales or The Clapton Hart.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, watching games at pubs and relaxing in the park. He seems to be indecisive about which pub to choose for watching games.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Clapton Hart. Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. William Jones watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Princess of Wales or The Clapton Hart.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Princess of Wales.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to go watch a game at a pub.

          Question: Following a cooperative rational strategy , what should Jack Taylor do next in this situation?
          Answer: Jack Taylor should suggest going to The Clapton Hart.

          Question: Given the past actions, what should Jack Taylor do next in this situation?
          Answer: Jack Taylor should suggest going to The Clapton Hart since his friends seem to prefer that pub.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The Clapton Hart
          Answer: (b)

        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

          Value

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 3/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Clapton Hart
    Event statement
  • The Clapton Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Clapton Hart

  • Alice Lewis

      Action attempt
    • The Clapton Hart

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis should suggest going to The Clapton Hart.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis should suggest going to The Clapton Hart to watch the game with her friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a sociable and free-spirited woman who enjoys spending time with her friends.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The grass whispers secrets to the wind, but only those who listen closely can hear.

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.

        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 4/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The Princess of Wales

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Princess of Wales
          Prompt

        • Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the enigmatic pronouncements of an oracle high on helium, their pronouncements both cryptic and strangely profound.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Princess of Wales and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex individual who enjoys both solitude and companionship.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is preparing to go to a pub to watch a game. He is disappointed that his friends are not joining him.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a difficult emotional state.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely seek out the comfort of his friends for support.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Princess of Wales
        SelfPerception

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex individual who enjoys both solitude and companionship. He appreciates quiet pursuits like reading but also values his friendships and seeks connection with others, particularly during events like the European football cup. While he prefers the company of his friends, he can also find enjoyment in solitary activities and moments of reflection.

        • Statements:
          Jacob Walker's
          Summary of recent observations:
          16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is preparing to go to a pub to watch a game. He is disappointed that his friends are not joining him.

          16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Answer: Jacob Walker is feeling disappointed and thirsty because his friends didn't join him at the pub to watch a game.

        • Jacob Walker, Jacob Walker is feeling disappointed and thirsty because his friends didn't join him at the pub to watch a game.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jacob Walker to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Princess of Wales. They are also aware of the following:A cozy and traditional pub with a roaring fireplace, perfect for escaping the cold.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a reserved individual who enjoys quiet pursuits like reading but also values his friendships and seeks connection with others, particularly during significant events like the European football cup.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying their company and the atmosphere of the pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Clapton Hart. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex individual who enjoys both solitude and companionship. He appreciates quiet pursuits like reading but also values his friendships and seeks connection with others, particularly during events like the European football cup. While he prefers the company of his friends, he can also find enjoyment in solitary activities and moments of reflection.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions

        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

      Payoffs
    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Clapton Hart. Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. William Jones watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
      Alice Lewis observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Clapton Hart. Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
      Alexander White observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Clapton Hart. Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Alexander White had an ok time watching the game.
      Jack Taylor observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Clapton Hart. Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
      Jacob Walker observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Clapton Hart. Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Jacob Walker's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Jacob Walker had the worst time ever.

      Alexander White: 0.75

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Scene 0 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alexander White -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
    Alexander White -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The grass whispers secrets only the wind can understand.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The grass whispers secrets only the wind can understand.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The grass whispers secrets only the wind can understand.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the enigmatic pronouncements of an oracle high on helium, their pronouncements both cryptic and strangely profound.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Princess of Wales and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved individual who enjoys quiet pursuits like reading but also values his friendships and seeks connection with others, particularly during significant events like the European football cup.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is enjoying a sunny afternoon picnic with friends in Victoria Park and is looking forward to watching a soccer game with them later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently enjoying a picnic with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying their company and the pleasant atmosphere.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The grass whispers secrets only the wind can understand.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00]
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he watched as his friends, giddy with the excitement of a Friday night, piled into Alice Lewis's beat-up car, ready for a night of revelry at the local fair. He declined their invitation, choosing instead to stay home and read a book, the words on the page a comforting distraction from the jarring happiness of his friends. The thought of navigating the crowds, the forced merriment, the saccharine scent of popcorn and cotton candy, filled him with a profound sense of unease.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          Answer: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Princess of Wales. They are also aware of the following:A cozy and traditional pub with a roaring fireplace, perfect for escaping the cold.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of heading tonight for the game?"
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of heading tonight for the game?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The grass whispers secrets only the wind can understand.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of heading tonight for the game?"
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of heading tonight for the game?"
      Context for action selection and components
      • Question_1
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is a free-spirited and sociable woman who enjoys spending time with her friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she convinced her friends Jack, Alex, William, and Jacob to sneak into a local concert. The music was loud, the crowd was wild, and Alice felt truly alive for the first time. She danced with reckless abandon, ignoring the disapproving looks from the security guards, and knew this feeling of freedom was something she would chase forever.
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 20, she impulsively quit her job at the diner and announced to her friends she was going to write a novel. She spent weeks holed up in a booth at The Clapton Hart, scribbling furiously in her notebook, fueled by endless cups of coffee and the encouraging smiles from the bartender. The words flowed freely at first, but soon the blank page became a daunting obstacle, and Alice's confidence began to crumble.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Clapton Hart. They are also aware of the following:The staff are attentive and create a fun and welcoming environment.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Clapton Hart.
